metadata.Description: Online platforms that connect borrowers and lenders directly.

entities.Description: Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.

Online platforms that connect borrowers and lenders directly.
Technologies that have been used for energy generation and distribution for a long time.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
The use of clean and efficient cookstoves and fuels to reduce indoor air pollution and improve health, environment, and livelihoods.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.
Renewable energy certificates, also known as green certificates or tradable renewable certificates, are proof that a certain amount of electricity has been generated from renewable sources.

relations.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies

relations.Description: Renewable energy certificates contribute to climate change mitigation efforts by promoting the use of clean and sustainable energy sources.

relations.Subject: energy storage
relations.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

relations.Subject: energy markets
relations.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

relations.Subject: renewable energy certificates

relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.
Loan originators are entities that originate loans on peer-to-peer lending platforms. They assess borrower creditworthiness, structure loan agreements, and manage the loan repayment process.
relations.Subject: loan originators

relations.Description: Investors are individuals or institutions that provide funds on peer-to-peer lending platforms. They earn returns based on the interest and principal repayments from borrowers.
relations.Subject: investors

relations.Description: Borrowers are individuals or businesses that seek loans on peer-to-peer lending platforms. They can access funds at competitive interest rates and with flexible terms.
relations.Subject: borrowers

relations.Description: Credit scoring models are algorithms used by peer-to-peer lending platforms to assess the creditworthiness of borrowers. These models analyze various data points to determine the likelihood of loan repayment.
relations.Subject: credit scoring models

relations.Description: Loan agreements are legal contracts between borrowers and investors facilitated by peer-to-peer lending platforms. These agreements outline the terms and conditions of the loan, including interest rates, repayment schedules, and penalties.
relations.Subject: loan agreements
